ooC: oops, forgot 'bout this post.

-- Pacifix / Anachronox --

Not bothering to reply, Anachronox backs off. His body's angry 
defensive posture is replaced by a neutral postion back slightly 
behind Belthassan. 

Pacifix's face drops slightly, but only for a moment. "I would like 
to do something to help, but frankly, I don't know what I can do..." 
He paces the room, "Very well. Although i regret it, I'll have to 
leave him here with the Tripredacus. I'll have Hoist research the 
problem, and if he comes up with anything I'll contact you 
immediately." Facing Daemos, he nods in respect, "If you don't mind, 
I'll be leaving. Contact me if something happens that I should know 
about." He waits, out of politeness, to be shown to the exit.


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Daemos: Anachronox, stand back. He is not an enemy. I am afraid, 
> Pacifix, that he is right. Our renewal chamber reformatted him in 
> order to repair him, but he has lost his ancient self in the 
process. 
> 
> Belthassan: That is true. I found him first. He seems to have no 
> memories of his life before that of Anachronox...
